reviews.text: Can't beat the price, at around 119PLN per night. Hotel is fairly new, clean and comfortable. It is located within a 10 minute walk of the railway station. Hotel is quite large with over 200 rooms. Check-in was fast and friendly. You will be asked to pay for your stay in advance. Rooms are very quiet inside as soundproofing is excellent. Rooms are basic but functional. Free wifi, flat screen tv with only one English channel, shower, basin and toilet. The room had a double bed, which was comfortable, rooms are also air conditioned. Bath towels could be of a little better quality. Buffet breakfast served each morning, extra cost, decent value. Lobby is well kept, there is one computer terminal available. Hotel is within walking distance of most everything, buses and trams stop almost at the front door.
reviews.title: Great price nice hotel

reviews.text: The Ibis Budget hotel is located just 200 metres from Galeria Krakowska (shopping centre) and 300 from Railway Station. The Main Market Square is 700 metres away. Each air-conditioned room has satellite TV and shower.The building presents nicely from outside.Inside is also very nice and clean.Hotel have friendly and helpful staff. My double room was not too big, but very cosy and had comfortable bed. Hotel Ibis offers (extra charge) breakfast and free Wifi. Its a very good place to stay for few days ( good price per night) and explore the beautiful city. I recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice and cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent choice for an inexpensive stay inn Krakow. Very conveniently located right beside the train station and a few minutes walk from the historic center of town. Although our room looked out on the railway tracks we absolutely could not hear the trains--great soundproofing! Rooms are tiny but completely functional and clean, perfect for someone who will spend all day out touring anyway. Staff were professional and friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent inexpensive hotel in Krakow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Budget is better than many 4 or 5 stern hotels. It was very very clean, great price, very good location, closed to shopping center, supermarket, bookstore, so on... The bed was very confortable, the shower very good with cromotherapy, but the toilets and shower are separate, if you will stay couples, ok. The towels is just one for each person, don't have towels to hand or floor. The breakfast is basic, but good.
reviews.title: Very good!

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for one reason - its location. You can access it directly from the main railway station in Kraków - just go to tunnel at the north end of each platform, turn left and you'll be there.
reviews.title: Great price for location

reviews.text: Even though it is called a budget hotel, it delivers pretty well on the budget name. Spotlessly clean, very modern, ideally located, this place is a fantastic deal. Located right next to the train station and the big mall, it's a short 10 minute pleasant walk to Old Town. The mall has supermarkets and cafes to stock up on, along with mobile providers to get a sim card at. The rooms at ibis are simple to the point where you wonder why you need all that other stuff in other hotels. The staff is helpful and courteous. Wifi is free. I skipped on the breakfast only because I found some really awesome local breakfast joints just up the street close to the university. All in all, very recommended.
reviews.title: Very ideal if you want a budget stay.

reviews.text: I stayed at the mid-range Ibis in Warsaw when I arrived in Poland but went budget for Krakow. The Ibis Budget Stare Miasta is others have described a very basic hotel, with an excellent location. The train station and huge Krakow Galleria shopping mall are right outside your door and the sights of the town are in short walking distance. Rooms are small and reminded me of an IKEA display, the bed is on the hard side, but everything is clean and as expected for this price range. The rooms also don't have phones or hairdryers (there are 3 that are loaned out to guests). What made my stay really enjoyable was the staff who were were great! They spoke very good English and helped me with my Polish, as well as attended to every question and request. The buffet breakfast is ok if you are heading out early: bread, cereals, coldcuts, hotdogs, and yogurts. But with the mall next door that has a few eating establishments, fresh pretzels on almost every street corner and cafes and restaurants found all around the main square, you really won't lack for food choices.
reviews.title: Great price and location for Krakow - but remember it is budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is next to the shopping mall as well as the main train station. It is about 10 minutes walk to the outskirts of the Old Town. The hotel itself is immaculate as it was only opened before EURO 2012, it is clean and cheerful although very basic so if it is only a cheap sleep in a comfy bed that you are after then it is a very good choice.
reviews.title: Know what you are getting and you'll be fine!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hey! so what do you want? An easy to find location, friendly reception, clean room, good bed, hot shower and tv that actually works?!!! Youve got it all here for a bargain price - i paid about 18 euros per night! That beats many flea ridden, sleazy location noisy hell holes hands down! Sure you can stay in the jewish quarter or the market place hotels but the joy for me was being central enough to walk to these locations with ease! One of the best bargains i have found in years of travel.
reviews.title: Wow! bargain and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in the middle of Feb for a trip to Auschwitz and Birkenau and we were really surprised at how clean and comfortable the Budget Hotel was.
reviews.title: Great Stay for a great price too!

reviews.text: I never stayed in Ibis budget so thought of trying it.I am fine with normal IBIS hotels i have stayed in but budget is really no frills.
reviews.title: Really budget

reviews.text: It is about 5-8 minutes walk from the Krakow railway station.
reviews.title: Stay in Budget Hotel Krakow

reviews.text: Well the room is decent size with bathroom literally in the room.It just has a glass door.The wash basin again in the room.Small bed but ok for the price.
reviews.title: Clean comfortable no frills hotel
Great Location, Great Price, Great Service
reviews.text: I love Ibis for the cleanliness.Everything was neat and clean.Nice an tidy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They do not have a restaurant but can eat in the Ibis next door.I had soup there and it was good.Also they took order when they were almost closing down the kitchen.The bar is decently priced.
reviews.title: Good location and price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great, clean hotel which was cheap. Its in a great location near the centre of town. Even though it was opposite the train station, during our 3 nights we did not hear a single train. The hotel staff were happy to help us with our questions and even teach us a bit of Polish. Really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it.
reviews.title: Ibis Budget Hotel Krakow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is situated close to the railway station and Galeria Krakowska which is very comfortable for those travelling by train. Besides, if you want to go shopping or to have a bite it is easy to do that as the shopping center- Galeria Krakowska is right in front of the hotel. In addition, it is close to the city center, so you don't even have to use any type of transport.
reviews.title: Excellent location and value for money

reviews.text: The room is not big but there is everything you need in it: wonderful shower with special rainbow lighting))), basin, mirrors, toilet, TV, table and 2 stools. Cleanliness is on the high level, it is done every day with change of towels.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
No frills, excellent value
reviews.text: The staff is very helpful and eager to consult you on interesting excursions that you can order at the hotel at good value. General impression is wonderful!

Stayed here end of November 2012 and cant fault the place, obviously it is very basic as is reflected in the price but still very clean and really fresh with good decor as is so new. Only prob we had was the shower! not great if your just staying with a friend as its very see through, but if you turn the lights off the shower head is coloured light so this prevented any embarassment!
reviews.title: Not only for budget travellers
